definition: to put on a hat/to be first/to dub
distinct/clear/orderly/pain/suffering/deciduous bush used in Chinese medicine (genus Vitex)/punishment cane (old)
surname Chu/abbr. for Hubei 湖北省[Hu2 bei3 Sheng3] and Hunan 湖南省[Hu2 nan2 Sheng3] provinces together/Chinese kingdom during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (722-221 BC)
distinct/clear/orderly/pain/suffering/deciduous bush used in Chinese medicine (genus Vitex)/punishment cane (old)
surname Chu/abbr. for Hubei 湖北省[Hu2 bei3 Sheng3] and Hunan 湖南省[Hu2 nan2 Sheng3] provinces together/Chinese kingdom during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (722-221 BC)

sentences.english: He had not become a trim self-satisfied city man .
sentences.chinese: 他没有变成一个衣冠楚楚，神气十足的城里人。

sentences.english: A well-dressed elderly servant opened the door .
sentences.chinese: 一个衣冠楚楚的老仆人开了门。

sentences.english: He was always well-dressed and smart-looking.
sentences.chinese: 他总是衣冠楚楚，样子挺帅。

sentences.english: Maybe your casual style doesn't fly in your buttoned-down workplace.
sentences.chinese: 也许那时你随意的风格和衣冠楚楚的工作地点不匹配。

sentences.english: He cultivates a dandified image and languid manner.
sentences.chinese: 他培养了一个衣冠楚楚的形象和地花鼓。

definition: variant of 氣宇軒昂|气宇轩昂[qi4 yu3 xuan1 ang2]
lit. dressed up animal (idiom)/fig. immoral and despicable person
to make a show of being decent and proper/to display phony or hypocritical behavior
to have an imposing or impressive appearance/impressive appearance/straight and impressive looking
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
robust and prosperous (a compliment in former times)/fat person (modern)
